title: Lovely place
text: Had a lovely time here. The view from the caravan deck to the sea was lovely. Staff went out of their way to help and provide advice which you don’t get at some of the big national chains. Only disappointment was that we couldn’t book a slot for the indoor pool - tried and tried but couldn’t get one! Would definitely return here.

title: Best model village we’ve been to!
text: Really impressive model village which we walked around twice. Not too busy when we visited. Lovely, friendly staff and a nice little cafe at the end. If you have kids, a good couple of hours to spend here.

title: Well worth it!
text: It’s an expensive treat, but really enjoyable steam journey back and forth including almost half a day in Dartmouth which was enjoyable. Would recommend it!
place: Dartmouth Steam Railway and River Boat

title: Enjoyable afternoon
text: Had good weather which always helps, and generally enjoyed the afternoon there, but the number of empty enclosures and indoor attractions which were closed (for obvious safety reasons) meant it felt like an expensive day out. The signage for queuing at some of the kiosks also wasn’t great so could be improved.

title: Excellent family activity
text: We enjoyed our ‘ram raid’ escape room. Lots of clues, tech to use for clues and a really good set of rooms!

title: Lovely hotel
text: Enjoyed staying here, staff were excellent, but couldn’t use the pool as it was already fully booked for most of the day when we dropped our bags off at 9:20am (and one of the reasons we booked this hotel). A couple of other minor issues whilst there, but would stay here again!

title: Great free attraction
text: Don’t often get free attractions in London. It was well organised and excellent views across London (even on a rainy day). You can walk round in about 15 mins, but it’s nice to find a comfy chair and appreciate the views.

title: Something a bit different!
text: Visited on the recommendation of a colleague and we weren’t disappointed. Really well organised and a we had a great time with the games. Took a while to work out how to get the points, but really good fun!

title: Meal was ok, service was good
text: Meal was ok for most of us, but the pizza my son had tasted like a supermarket version with a bit of extra cheese, not a fresh pizza. We were also promised free desserts on arrival which we didn’t actually receive. Service was very good.

title: Average Italian restaurant
text: Food average. My pasta dish tasted bland, my wife’s was too heavy on the chilli taste. Charged a lot for bread (which is free or cheaper in other locations) and assumed I wanted bottled water rather than tap water. Overall was overpriced and just not good enough. (The restaurant opposite was busy, but only us and one other couple at this one. Should probably have gone to the other restaurant instead)

title: Best Italian food in Athens!
text: Had two meals here, both were excellent. The quality of the food was outstanding. The service was good and the prices were reasonable for its location.

title: Excellent beach and services
text: Paid 2 euros each, but everything was clean and very well kept - clean toilets, changing rooms, no litter anywhere. Water was clean and sandy beach (some small pebbles, but not ones which hurt your feet!) so good for kids. Lunch was good value. My 14 year old daughter loved it!

title: Square and Parliament building
text: The square was a bit scruffy - a couple of broken benches, some graffiti and a couple of homeless people. I wouldn’t say it’s anything special at all (would score 3 out if 5) however, the guards at the parliament were interesting / entertaining to watch. The timing of their moves was amazing.

title: Great for a rainy day
text: We spent an entire afternoon (to avoid the rain) here so the entry fee was good value. Most of the machines were working and I think we collectively played over 80 pinball machines! From the 1960s to present day. Friendly staff and a something really unusual. Worth a visit!

title: Large grounds, lots of ruins!
text: It was free entry the day we went as it was a public holiday which was a good start! It’s an interesting site and worth visiting, but didn’t have too much in terms of information showing what buildings used to be like and how the site degraded so much over the years.

title: Lovely for a quiet walk
text: Spent an hour or so walking round as something different to do. The park is a bit ‘rustic’ and a bit scruffy in places, but we enjoyed the visit as a relaxing place to write a few postcards home.

title: Busy place!
text: A busy place with lots of shops and places to eat. Seems to be where a mix of locals and tourists hang out.

title: Better than we expected
text: Yes it’s an old stadium, but it’s more than that. You really get the feeling of being somewhere special. My son and I did a 100m sprint along the track. Really good! And the Olympic museum was an extra treat there. Well worth the 5 euro entry fee

title: Tourist area, but with a lot of history
text: Enjoyed walking around here a couple of evenings. Loads of trinkets to buy and some unusual crafts with ruins nearby. Lots of decent restaurants also.

title: Story of the Acropolis
text: Covered the story of the acropolis and contained a lot of the statues and pieces recovered from the grounds. Enjoyable, but wasn’t clear on the stories of some of the pieces and a whole floor for a restaurant and book shop seemed a bit over the top.

title: The symbol of Athens
text:
Very busy with a number of cruise ship tours arriving at the same time, but we managed to see everything at our own pace. Amazing place to walk around.
Only minor disappointment was the ticket machines don’t issue discount or free tickets for children, you have to ask the person at the gate (or queue up at the desk).

title: Very enjoyable lunch
text: First time here. Good, simple and reasonable value lunchtime menu. Service was good, food was very good and I will be returning sometime soon!

title: Business meal
text:
Had a meal with a group of 12.
The service was exceptional and the food was also excellent. The desert wasn’t quite up to the level of the starters and main course, but a very enjoyable evening here.

title: Great pies!
text:
Great pies! Loads of choice.
Service was good.
Only thing to be aware of is they don’t serve chips on an evening.

No room for desert though as the pies are very filling!

title: Great food and better than expected service
text:
Six of us had dinner here, one an ex-chef who rates the food here. The food was great, no complaints at all and had no issues ordering more than six dishes at a time from the bottomless menu.

I was expecting the to have a few issues with service based on the tripadvisor reviews, but had no issues at all.

Overall: good food, good service good value for the amount of food & drink we had!

title: A good value meal!
text: There was plenty of choice on the menu and good value meals. Service was ok. We all enjoyed our visit here.

title: Very busy! But good overall
text: Had to wait 20 mins to be seated as it was a busy Friday evening. Food and service all ok. Although it was relatively expensive, the salad, soup and breadsticks were all included so we were all very full!

title: Lovely family beach
text: We happened upon this beach as found it difficult/ expensive to part at Laguna Beach. It was cheap to park at this beach, it was clean and lots of families here. Very enjoyable morning spent here.

title: Entertaining and informative tour
text: The driver seemed to be able to navigate and miss all of the traffic, so was able to show us the sights of Hollywood, Beverley Hills and everything in between.

title: A long walk!
text: The walk of fame is a lot longer than we expected! After walking for 40 mins, we’d had enough. Quite difficult to see some of the stars as it’s so busy and a few had been damaged. Still worth doing though!

title: Great theme park
text:
Quite a bit of queuing, but managed to get on all of the rides and see most of the shows. We enjoyed the studio backlot tour - took an hour, but was really good.
Be prepared to get soaked on the Jurassic World ride!

title: Good variety of Disney themed shops and other places
text: Enjoyed a stroll around here. Some good and unusual Disney themed merchandise. Didn’t stop for a meal, but had a coffee break whilst walking round.

title: Good Disney theme park
text: Not quite as big as the Florida park and they could have built more Star Wars themed rides in that area, but other than that, a great day out.

title: Great theme park
text: We really enjoyed this theme park, from the variety of rides, all really good, to the evening show to the drawing classes. Excellent day out. We found enough to fill two days here (went on a few rides twice!)

title: Good pit stop after Yosemite, but nothing more
text: Food and service were both ok. Nothing special here, but did the job. Reasonable pricing for the food and drinks.

title: Well worth the visit!
text: Such an amazing place to walk around. It wasn’t too busy and the shuttle bus from the carpark made it fairly stress free. We walked around for just over an hour, but there was a number of walks you could chose from.

title: Great view!
text:
Great view.
It was very busy, but managed to get parked quickly and enjoy the the view of the valley.

title: Has the wow factor - amazing
text:
Just such a fantastic place with fantastic views. It’s a bit of a drive up there, but well worth it. Haven’t ever seen scenery like
It.

Only minor issue was the toilets - they need servicing and cleaning more often!

title: Lovely area to walk around
text: Some lovely, traditional buildings and a park opposite to relax or have a picnic. Some great views over San Francisco from here.

title: A park in the city!
text: Really enjoyable stroll around this park. It actually seemed like you were away from the city, but it was in the heart of lots of offices! Lovely planting and really well kept. If you want a couple of hours for something different to do in San Fran, this is a good option.

title: Good pizza, but service was a bit slow
text: Enjoyable meal/ good pizza, but the time from ordering to delivery of the food was longer than expected and it took us a while to find the waiter to pay for the meal.

title: Good views from the balcony, but average food
text: We expected more from this place, but the menu was extensive which normally means most food isn’t prepared from scratch on the premises. Food was ok, service was ok, price was high (not really worth the price paid), but the view from the balcony over Union Square was good.

title: Good food!
text: Stopped here for a late lunch. A busy and a touristy place, but the food was good. It’s a bit more expensive due to its location, but we all enjoyed our meals here.

title: Lovely walk up and down the piers.
text: Spent all day here walking up and down the piers. Some unusual shops and some random things to see such as the seals off Pier 39 (I think). Great place to visit.

title: Good experience riding the cable car!
text: Good experience, but they really pack people in and it seems to be inconsistent timings. Sometime you wait 2 mins, sometimes over 10 mins. But enjoyable all the same.

title: Excellent bike ride
text: In and out of this place a bit too quickly, but customer service was good and the bikes were ok. No issues encountered picking up or dropping off. Good location to get onto the bike paths quickly.
place: Blazing Saddles Bike Rentals and Tours

title: In cloud!
text: A lovely bike ride over the bridge, but couldn’t see much due to the cloud! Shame as it probably looks fantastic on a clear day.

title: Good location
text:
Stayed here for 4 nights. We had a suite which was all fine. The check-in was quick and check-out was a keycard drop off so also quick. We used the pool a couple of times, which we enjoyed.

The only things which could
Have been better were:
The shop to buy essential breakfast food was outrageously expensive, so we went to a local supermarket and
we also saw a few homeless people in the local area, but that’s not the fault of the hotel.

title: Very interesting and varied artwork
text: Spent an hour here on a Saturday morning before flying home. Not a huge place, but the building inside and out is very impressive and likewise the artworks are varied and impressive also.

title: Good location
text:
First of all the good bits:
- Good location
- Good check-in process
- Room was generally ok

But some areas which weren’t so good:
- Windows for some of the rooms look out onto the shopping arcade, but there was a lot of noise so was woken up early!
- The hot selection at breakfast was a random selection including carrots and other veg. It’s breakfast not dinner! In hindsight I should haven’t booked breakfast and gone elsewhere.
- Low shower pressure
place: Novotel Suites Den Haag City Centre

title: Disappointed with this branch of Bill’s
text:
Arrived and seated quickly which was good, but then took a while for someone to take our order.

There was an error on the drinks (they delivered one drink too many), the meals took over 40 mins from ordering to delivery and there was also an error on one of the meals (which was then rectified quickly).

Given the place was fairly empty (people at other tables), the service was slow and disappointing compared to the normal standard at Bills!

title: A good pit stop!
text: We stopped for coffee & soft drinks whilst exploring Brighton. Good value, good coffee, reasonable prices. I’d visit there again when visiting Brighton - the ice-creams looked fantastic!

title: Good experience
text: Something really different to experience. Excellent views on the day we visited. Bit expensive normally, but kids were free at half term which made it more reasonable. Drinks were a bit expensive (£10 for a glass of sparkling wine), but other than that, very good!

title: Good meal, very good service
text:
Enjoyed our meal here.
Yes, the set menu is limited (we had a Groupon voucher), but choices were sufficient for us. Service was very good.
Overall very good value for the price paid.

title: Great hotel!
text:
We had a lovely 10 nights here.

Good points:
The 2 bedroom suites are huge and very well equipped
The pool never seemed to get too busy, we could always find sunbeds near the pool
A good selection at breakfast everyday
Good, attentive staff
In a fairly quiet area

Areas could be improved:
None for the hotel itself, but would have been good if the hotel reception had responded to my emails in advance of staying there rather than having to call them.

Would highly recommend staying here if you are staying in Crete.

title: Good selection of shops and restaurants
text: Enjoyed walking round the old town most evenings whilst staying in Rethymo. So many independent shops, cafes and restaurants. No chain fast food places which was surprising, but good.

title: Enjoyable visit, although can be very hot!
text: Spent a few hours walking round. Cheap to visit, but lots to see. Some of the signage could be improved around the fortress ie more about its history, but an enjoyable visit overall.

title: Good meal and service
text:
Good meal and good service.
Did get very busy which shows how popular this place is. A bit more expensive compared to some other places in Reading, but an enjoyable evening with friends.

title: Nice evening(s) here
text: Visited this place three times in the last three months. It’s great to try different beers, wasn’t too loud or packed (even on Saturday) and had a good atmosphere in the bar area. The food was good too!

title: Enjoyable visit
text:
Excellent gardens which we really enjoyed walking round. The house was very good, but some rooms and areas are in desperate need of renovation.

Only annoyance was the toilet block - it smelled awful, it wasn’t properly cleaned and was also in need of renovation.

Otherwise, it was a very enjoyable visit and we’ll be returning again!
